column4: I'm having problems installing the 32bit driver for the canon pixma mx320 all-in-one-printer on my 64bit system (11.04)
the Install is showing missing dependencies that are installed already
cnijfilter-common:i386 hängt ab von libcupsys2 (>= 1.2.1) | libcups2.
at least I get an answer this way :P
that cannot be a reason to violate guidelines
anyway, you say you have 64bit system, but the package you are trying to install seems to be .i386 (32 bit)
it doesn't seem to be any 64bit drivers avail
you should not mix those architectures. Ask the maintainers of that package, what can we do about that?
I know I shouldn't. But thee's this printer and I want to get it running ...
yes, but we cannot support 3rd party software
I see. do you still have any idea, why dpkg sais there are dependencies
yes, because you are mixing architectures. That. Won't. Work
so the only way would be to install 32bit version of Ubuntu?
I have no idea. There might be other possibilities, ask the manufacturer
